intro: Apinagia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited apinagia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin, while its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Apinagia microcarpa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate to subtropical climates.
